head.title: Why Not Swathe Shoreham in Fine Silk?; Nuclear Is Better

hedline.hl1: Why Not Swathe Shoreham in Fine Silk?; Nuclear Is Better

block.p: I am pleased and surprised to read (news story, July 14) that the agreement to shut Shoreham as a nuclear plant may fail. Such a failure would benefit the people of Long Island. More serious than the rate increases and more serious than the building of replacement gas-turbine power plants at five sites around Long Island are the health hazards of burning oil, gas and coal.

The current heat wave clearly shows what the world will be like if we keep burning fossil fuels, which put carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. Nuclear power surely isn't perfect, but it is a lot better than the alternatives. JAY M. PASACHOFF Williamstown, Mass., July 20, 1988 The writer, Field Memorial Professor of Astronomy at Williams College, is the author of books on physics and astronomy.
